content.text: Water flows from the full tank into a cylinder at a rate of \(0.3 \text{m}^3 /\text{min}\)
Calculate the time it takes for the full tank to empty
Give your answer in minutes and seconds
The radius of the cylinder is \(0.4 \text{m}\)
Calculate the depth of water, \(d\), when all the water from the rectangular tank is in the cylinder
The cylinder has a height of \(1.2 \text{m}\) and is open at the top
The inside surface is painted at a cost of \(\$ 2.30\) per \(\text{m}^2\)
Calculate the cost of painting the inside surface
A rectangular tank measures \(1.2 \text{m}\) by \(0.8 \text{m}\) by \(0.5 \text{m}\)
Complete the table of values for \(y = 2^{x}\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = 2^{x}\) for \(-2 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\)
On the grid, draw the straight line which passes through the points (0, 2) and (3, 8)
The equation of this line is \(y = mx + 2\)
Show that the value of \(m\) is 2
One answer to the equation \(2^{x} = 2x + 2\) is \(x = 3\)
Use your graph to find the other answer
Draw the tangent to the curve at the point where \(x = 1\)
Use this tangent to calculate an estimate of the gradient of \(y = 2^{x}\) when \(x = 1\)
Give a reason why \(DC\) is not parallel to \(AE\)
The diagram shows a circle centre \(O\)
\(A, B\) and \(C\) are points on the circumference
Draw the reflection of shape \(P\) in the line \(y = x\)
Draw the translation of shape \(P\) by the vector \(\begin{pmatrix} - 2 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\)
Find the 2 by 2 matrix which represents this transformation
(i) Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps shape \(P\) onto shape \(W\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation represented by the matrix \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 2 \end{pmatrix}\)
The cost of a bottle of juice is 5 cents more than the cost of a bottle of water
Mohini buys 3 bottles of water and 6 bottles of juice
Find the cost of a bottle of water
Find the total cost of 2 biscuits and 1 cake
The cost of a biscuit is \(x\) cents
The cost of a cake is \((x + 3)\) cents
The number of biscuits Roshni can buy for 72 cents is 2 more than the number of cakes she can buy for 72 cents
Calculate the angle of elevation of \(P\) from \(A\)
The diagram shows a triangular prism of length \(12\mathrm{cm}\)
The rectangle \(ABCD\) is horizontal and the rectangle \(DCPQ\) is vertical
The cross-section is triangle \(PBC\) in which angle \(BCP = 90^{\circ}\), \(BC = 4 \text{cm}\) and \(CP = 3 \text{cm}\)
Write down the class interval that contains the median
Calculate an estimate of the mean
Use the information in the table opposite to complete the cumulative frequency table
On the grid, draw a cumulative frequency diagram
Use your diagram to find the median, the lower quartile and the inter-quartile range
The times, \(t\) minutes, taken for 200 students to cycle one kilometre are shown in the table
Show all your working and give your answers correct to 2 decimal places
Give your answer in its simplest form
Write down the probability that the card chosen shows the letter M
If this is carried out 100 times, write down the expected number of times the card chosen shows the letter M
One card is chosen at random from Set A and replaced
Two cards are chosen at random, **without** replacement, from Set A
Find the probability that both cards show the letter S
One card is chosen at random from Set A and one card is chosen at random from Set B
Find the probability that exactly one of the two cards shows the letter U
A card is chosen at random, **without** replacement, from Set B until the letter shown is either I or U
Find the probability that this does not happen until the 4th card is chosen
The diagram shows two sets of cards
Hassan must store at least 200 books
Hassan must not use more than 15 boxes
He must use at least 3 small boxes
The number of small boxes must be less than or equal to the number of large boxes
Write down three inequalities to show this information
On the grid, show the information in **part (a)** and **part (b)** by drawing four straight lines and shading the **unwanted** regions
Find the least possible total cost of the boxes
Find the number of large boxes and the number of small boxes which give this least possible cost
A large box costs \(5 and a small box costs\) 2
Hassan stores books in large boxes and small boxes
Each large box holds 20 books and each small box holds 10 books
He has \(x\) large boxes and \(y\) small boxes
Mark the point \(R\) on the grid
Write down the position vector of the point \(P\)
The points \(P\) and \(Q\) have co-ordinates \((- 3, 1)\) and \((5, 2)\)
\(K\) is on \(UV\) so that \(\overrightarrow{UK} = \frac{2}{3} \overrightarrow{UV}\) and \(L\) is on \(OU\) so that \(\overrightarrow{OL} = \frac{3}{4} \overrightarrow{OU}\)
Find the following in terms of \(\mathbf{u}\) and \(\mathbf{v}\), giving your answers in their simplest form
Write the two missing terms in the spaces. 2, 6, ...... , 20,
Write down an expression in terms of \(n\) for the \((n + 1)\) th term
The difference between the \(n\) th term and the \((n + 1)\) th term is \(pn + q\)
Find the positions of the two consecutive terms which have a difference of 140
The \(n\) th term of a sequence is \(n(n + 1)\)
Two consecutive terms of the sequence are 3413 and 6827
Find the term before and the term after these two given terms
A sequence \(u_{1}, u_{2}, u_{3}, u_{4}, \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots\) is given by the following rules
For example, the third term is \(u_{3}\) and \(u_{3} = 2u_{1} + u_{2} = 2\times 2 + 3 = 7.\)
